content.question: Assume Nadia voluntarily leaves a job with a salary of <math alttext="$100" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>100</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> per day to open and run a restaurant instead. After deducting all explicit costs from the restaurant revenues, Nadia has a gain of <math alttext="$120" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>120</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Assuming there are no additional implicit costs, which of the following statements is true?

choices.label: Nadia has an accounting profit of <math alttext="$20" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>20</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.
Nadia has an accounting profit of <math alttext="$100" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>100</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.
Nadia has an economic profit of <math alttext="$20" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>20</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.
Nadia has an economic profit of <math alttext="$120" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>120</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.
Nadia has an economic profit of <math alttext="negative $20" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>âˆ’</mo><mi>$</mi><mn>20</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: Nadia has an economic profit of <math alttext="$20" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>20</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

unit.text: 3: Production, Cost, and the Perfect Competition Model

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Identify an economic concept, principle, or model using quantitative data or calculations.
